data.name: Matt Overton‚Äôs Blockhouse is Investment in His City and His Future | Colts Roundup

data.message: Great story but also points out an issue in the modern sports world. We have a large number of professional athletes that although making large sums of money have a large reluctance to personally invest in their team's city. In this day when players are traded as frequently as cards at your local gambling venue, they are an injury or a team financial advantage from being traded away from any local investment they make. Kudos to Overton for being daring in this respect.

Good business move...Cherilus wasn't healthy and Mewhort was drafted to be his eventual successor at some point, sooner or later...Reitz will now be entrenched as the #2 RT, as well as the competent, multi-position OL...The Colts traditionally are not big on drafting OG's early on in drafts, so you'd had to have believed that LG was a matter of plugging in Mewhort into a position of need, as best available, rather than of future incumbency...Ideally, Donald Thomas would be the starting LG, if healthy, with Lance Louis backing him, and Hugh Thornton behind Herremanns at RG...They drafted an OL in the 7th Round from a small school who's going to need time to develop...No guarantees though about his future

data.name: Who Are The Most Indispensable Colts For The 2015 Season?

data.message: My top 7 goes as follows. 1. Andrew Luck of Course. 2. Vontae Davis. 3. T.Y. Hilton. 4. Adam Vinatieri 5. Robert Mathis/Colts D-line by committee because idk who else is dependable just yet. A healthy Mathis is a dangerous Mathis. 6. The running backs by committee again it depends on who breaks out as the workhorse between Boom and Gore and 7. Us fans because the players need our support each and every weekend so bleed blue and scream loud! GO COLTS! RESPECT THE SHOE!!!

The only season killer would be if Andrew Luck got hurt. The next tier down would be Vontae Davis. Then in tier 3, would be Anthony Castanzo, TY Hilton, and Adam Vinatieri. I'd really want to say Robert Mathis, dude is a freak, but at his age, with that injury, I'm not optimistic.

Andrew Luck, Frank Gore "I really wanna see him run over 1000 this coming season, Robert Mathis " hope he stays healthy this year, I wanna see him sack whiner Brady multiple times when we play cheatriots.

We can have 7 important guys but the 1 we absolutely can't lose is ANDREW LUCK!  He the one guy that makes the engine run!  As many say it's a quarterback driven league and the Colts have a GREAT one!

1) Andrew Luck 
2) Andrew Luck 
3) Andrew Luck 
4) Andrew Luck 
5) Andrew Luck 

With that said Matt Hasselbeck is one of the best backups out there and could win games.
We can lose anyone but Luck and still make the playoffs. I think all the injuries last year proved that.  But with our talent at WR I think even an aging Hasselbeck gives us a winning season.
My top 7: 1. Andrew Luck  2. Vontae Davis  3. T.Y. Hilton 4. Adam Vinatieri  5. Robert Mathis  6.  Pat McAfee 7.  Frank Gore/Andre Johnson
Did anyone watch every game last season? I did. Mathis doesn't belong on this list. Yeah, he can push his weight but rarely gains any yards!
The running game, if no running backs, we see what happens when Luck had to do too much. They need a steady running game. Gore and back-up, in my opinion.
Andrew Luck, Anthony Castanzo, Pat McAfee, Robert Mathis, TY Hilton, Vontae Davis, Coby Fleener
1. Andrew Luck     2. Anthony Castonzo     3. Vontae Davis   4. Pat McAfee     5. Adam Vinatieri     6. Frank Gore     7.  TY Hilton
Fleener needs to get better run blocking but is favirite of Luck which puts him in my top 5.
I would have a hard time including T. Y. only because of the depth the team has at WR. I would go Andrew Luck, Vontae Davis, Anthony Castonzo, Jack Mewhort, Frank Gore.
Sorry but I'm not really that impressed with Art Jones he got man handled at the line many times last season
Andrew Luck, Andrew Luck, Andrew Luck, Andrew Luck, Andrew Luck, Andrew Luck, and Andrew  Luck.
And...how many times did Adam put us on the board?
Art Jones stayed injured last season, that probably why. I bet he will have a much better season this year being 100% healthy, and on top of that he will have help.
our defense players, we are so deep on offense. And Andrew Luck is a tank so not worried about him and our O-Line is better now. Superbowl Bound!
Definitely, Vinatieri belongs on that list.  His accuracy can't be beat.

There's only 2. 

1. Andrew Luck 

2. Vontae Davis 

Anyone else if they go down it won't ruin our season.
My favorite Dwayne Allen!!  #83
Offense Andrew Luck Defense Arthur Jones
Anyone want to say coach?? I mean without his mind set would we be able to use the talent that we have? Or make the moves we did
Coach Jeff Fitzgerald !!!
Luck, Vontae, Jones, Lowrey, starting NT.

data.message: I read this great book about this amazing man. May God bless you Josh Bleill
Josh is a amazing young man! Had the pleasure of meeting him and hearing him speak.

Josh came to speak at a event we had at work. I gained a whole new level of respect for Jim Irsay from Josh's inspirational speech. Additionally, if you think you are facing adversity, Josh's bravery and story of accomplishment should be the standard you use to overcome it.
great American, a great spokesman and a true hero!

Josh spoke to our young football players at Our Lady of Grace. He was so gracious & patient with the little guys & their questions. I'm proud to have met him & shake his hand.
This man spoke at our local school. He is an outstanding man - a credit to the Colts, our military and our nation.

data.message: No TD'S allowed all of last season until he went against T.Y in the pro bowl? Ummmm he is the best....Sherwoman just runs his mouth
All I know is we're winning the Superbowl this year!!! Go Colts
I agree with the pro bowler, Davis is the best colts cornerback I've ever seen before.

Only reason why he isn't a number one is because the media blows revis and Sherman way up there but he didn't allow a single touchdown last season (minus the pro bowl) did revis or Sherman do that no but then again they had more ints but who needs turnovers when you shut receivers down with your coverage
Maybe the best trade colts history
Yes. All we need is a better run defense. Our pass defense is superb
Vikings fan and I think Vontae is the best. Chris Harris Jr. and Joe Haden are right there too
No, I don't agree. He's #1.

Sherman had a better defense overall around him that's why he is ranked so high. You don't see him take a wr one on one like Vontae or some of the better corners. Revis is great but he is getting older and won't stay great for much longer. Joe Haden and Patrick Peterson are good but I believe Vontae is better

Vontae is a beast. Top 3 in the NFL without a doubt. He just has a different play style. He breaks up a pass as opposed to intercepting it. Stats don't lie. Since hes been a Colt, and in a defensive scheme that fit his playing style, hes been an absolute beast. Chris Harris Jr and Joe Haden round out the top 5 with Sherman and Revis and the order doesn't matter. Cant really throw on any of them. Sherman should never get the nod at #1 though. The rest of the top 5 shadow the best wr all game long and still put up eye popping numbers. Too many times I've seen offenses out the 3rd or 4th wr on shermans side just to keep him occupied while they kill the left side. #1 corners follow #1 wrs. Period.

If we are being honest, no matter how versatile he is, Patrick Peterson doesn't deserve top 5 honors after last season. He's gotta earn that back. He allowed 8 touchdowns, and averaged a 118 qb passer rating against. Sherman and Revis both average a little above 40, and Davis? Davis averaged a 38 qb rating against. Single digit pass deflections. It may surprise some of you, but he wasn't even top 25 in pff rankings. The top 5 aren't in any order to me, because they are all proven to be the cream of the crop; Sherman, Davis, Harris Jr., Revis, and Haden.
Best colts corner back but not 2nd best in the NFL
#1, probably tied with Revis. Sherman can only completely lock down third-option Wide Receivers.
I've been a Colts fan since Bert Jones in the 70s, Vontae is the best . Other guys like Ray Buchanan were good but..
